    • Method Detail

      • getTeam

        public Team getTeam(java.lang.String teamName)
        This method will take a parameter of a team name and return the Team object corresponding to it. If it is unsuccessful, meaning the team does not exist, it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        teamName - -- the name of the team to be found
        Returns:
        the Team object for that team
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case it's not in there

      • getTeams

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Team> getTeams()

      • simulate

        public void simulate(Bracket startingBracket)
        This will be the method that actually does the work of determining the outcome of the games. It will use the seed/ranking from each team on the bracket and put it into an algorithm to somewhat randomly generate a winner
        Parameters:
        startingBracket - -- the bracket to be simulated upon. The master bracket

      • loadStartingBracket

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> loadStartingBracket()
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        reads Strings from initialMatches.txt into an ArrayList in order to construct the starting bracket
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Strings
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
